comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Le Vieux Paris (Old Paris) was a picturesque and entertaining model of life in old France created by the designer, Albert Robida and exhibited at the 1900 Paris Exposition. jes.sagepub.com/cgi/content/abstract/35/1/065/

comment.author: 25889396@N02
comment._content:
"Vieux Paris was the product of the active imagination of Albert Robida, a man who made his fame publishing cartoons of the future: a tomorrowland of airships, microbe-killing sanitary devices, and a strangely changed human race. Here, Robida had convinced the politicians at city hall that he should be allowed to bring to live Hugo's legend of religion and violence in Medieval Paris. You stand amazed as musicians and jugglers stroll the streets, food vendors clad in period costume hawked meat pies and mead, knights battled with wooden swords, and an Esmeralda danced with her goat as Quasimodo looked down from his plaster Notre Dame. Victor Hugo's masterpiece is swept into existence by the Wizard of the Twentieth Century. "
